attributes.action: ensure Harry Patch aged 108 the last surviving soldier from World War 1 be knighted by the Queen.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Harry Patch, the last British soldier alive to have fought in the trenches of the First World War, is now 108 years old and one of very few people who can directly recall the horror of that conflict. He left school in 1913 to become an apprentice plumber but three years later was conscripted, serving as a machine gunner in the Duke of Cornwall’s Light Infantry. Fighting in the mud and trenches during the Battle of Passchendaele, he saw a great many of his comrades die, and in one dreadful moment the shell that wounded him killed his three closest friends. I believe the country should honour this hero with a knighthood from the Queen, we should NEVER forget.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
